## What are we doing today? {.smaller}

## Adding Games

**What?**

- Play multiple games at once!

. . .

::: {.columns}
::: {.column width="50%"}
- For your 'turn', pick any of the 'sub-games' and make a turn
- First unable to move loses
:::
::: {.column .center-xy width="50%"}
<p style="display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle; min-height: 150px;">
![](chess_example.png){height="150px"}
</p>
`<p style="display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle;">+</p>`{=html}
<p style="display: inline-block; vertical-align: middle; min-height: 150px;">
![](hackenbush_example.png){height="150px"}
</p>
:::
:::
. . .

**Why?**

Given I know how good/bad positions $X$, $Y$ are, I should be able to figure out if $X + Y$ is good/bad.

## Why Numbers?

* No information is hidden
* No element of chance
* No possibility of stalemate / infinite games

. . .

**4 Outcomes** - Only external factor is play order.

|              | Blue 1st W | Blue 1st L |
| ---------    | ------------- | ------------- |
| Red 1st W | 1st Wins (Let's ignore) | Red Wins (negative) |
| Red 1st L | Blue Wins (positive) | 2nd Wins (zero) |

G = \left\{ G_L\ |\ G_R \right\}
$$

$$
0 = \left\{ \ |\ \right\} \ \ \ 1 = \left\{ 0\ |\ \right\} \ \ \ \frac{1}{2} = \left\{ 0\ |\ 1 \right\}

}$$

}$$

\{*|-1\} = \left\{\frac{1}{2}*\bigg|-\frac{1}{2}\right\} - \frac{1}{2}
}$$

## Hot and Cold Games

$$
G =\{a|b\}, t(G) = \frac{b-a}{2}
$$

. . .

$$
\overbrace{\{*|-1\}}^{\frac{1}{2}} +
\overbrace{\left\{-\frac{1}{2} \bigg| -1\right\}}^{\frac{1}{4}} +
\overbrace{\left\{0 \bigg| -\frac{1}{4}\right\}}^{\frac{1}{8}} +
\overbrace{\left\{\frac{1}{4}\bigg|\downarrow\right\}}^{\frac{1}{8}} +
\overbrace{\{1|1\}}^0 +
\overbrace{\{0|*\}}^0
$$

. . .

$$
\color{blue}{*} - \color{red}{1} + \color{blue}{0} - \color{red}{\downarrow} + 1* + \uparrow = \color{red}{0}
$$

. . .

$$
\color{blue}{*} - \color{red}{1} + \color{blue}{\frac{1}{4}} - \color{red}{\frac{1}{4}} + 1* + \uparrow = \color{blue}{\uparrow}
$$
